trans-unit.source: Service Bus
trans-unit.target: Service Bus

trans-unit.source: Service Bus
trans-unit.target: Service Bus

trans-unit.source: <token>sb1</token> provides a hosted, secure, and widely available infrastructure for widespread communication, large-scale event distribution, naming, and service publishing.
trans-unit.target: <token>sb1</token> provides a hosted, secure, and widely available infrastructure for widespread communication, large-scale event distribution, naming, and service publishing.

trans-unit.source: <token>sb2</token> provides connectivity options for <token>indigo1</token> and other service endpoints – including REST endpoints -- that would otherwise be difficult or impossible to reach.
trans-unit.target: <token>sb2</token> provides connectivity options for <token>indigo1</token> and other service endpoints – including REST endpoints -- that would otherwise be difficult or impossible to reach.

trans-unit.source: Endpoints can be located behind network address translation (NAT) boundaries, or bound to frequently-changing, dynamically-assigned IP addresses, or both.
trans-unit.target: Endpoints can be located behind network address translation (NAT) boundaries, or bound to frequently-changing, dynamically-assigned IP addresses, or both.

trans-unit.source: <token>sb2</token> provides both “relayed” and “brokered” messaging capabilities.
trans-unit.target: <token>sb2</token> provides both “relayed” and “brokered” messaging capabilities.

trans-unit.source: In the relayed messaging pattern, the relay service supports direct one-way messaging, request/response messaging, and peer-to-peer messaging.
trans-unit.target: In the relayed messaging pattern, the relay service supports direct one-way messaging, request/response messaging, and peer-to-peer messaging.

trans-unit.source: Brokered messaging provides durable, asynchronous messaging components such as <newTerm>Queues</newTerm>, <newTerm>Topics</newTerm>, and <newTerm>Subscriptions</newTerm>, with features that support publish-subscribe and temporal decoupling: senders and receivers do not have to be online at the same time; the messaging infrastructure reliably stores messages until the receiving party is ready to receive them.
trans-unit.target: Brokered messaging provides durable, asynchronous messaging components such as <newTerm>Queues</newTerm>, <newTerm>Topics</newTerm>, and <newTerm>Subscriptions</newTerm>, with features that support publish-subscribe and temporal decoupling: senders and receivers do not have to be online at the same time; the messaging infrastructure reliably stores messages until the receiving party is ready to receive them.

trans-unit.source: To use <token>sb1</token> features, install the <token>azure_1</token> SDK from the SDK <externalLink><linkText>download page</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=212999</linkUri></externalLink>, or see <link xlink:href="57075aa0-218f-4a93-9a33-24e62667ce46" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Using the NuGet Service Bus Package</link>.
trans-unit.target: To use <token>sb1</token> features, install the <token>azure_1</token> SDK from the SDK <externalLink><linkText>download page</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=212999</linkUri></externalLink>, or see <link xlink:href="57075aa0-218f-4a93-9a33-24e62667ce46" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Using the NuGet Service Bus Package</link>.

trans-unit.source: This includes design, implementation, hosting, and configuration of the service; the management of the <token>sb2</token> <token>servicensd</token>s, endpoints, and security claims; and the development of SOAP and REST-based clients.
trans-unit.target: This includes design, implementation, hosting, and configuration of the service; the management of the <token>sb2</token> <token>servicensd</token>s, endpoints, and security claims; and the development of SOAP and REST-based clients.

trans-unit.source: It also contains an overview of the new <token>sb2</token> “brokered” messaging features, including <link xlink:href="f10e1962-b1ff-42d4-9b49-750920118885" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Service Bus Queues, Topics, and Subscriptions</link>.
trans-unit.target: It also contains an overview of the new <token>sb2</token> “brokered” messaging features, including <link xlink:href="f10e1962-b1ff-42d4-9b49-750920118885" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Service Bus Queues, Topics, and Subscriptions</link>.

trans-unit.source: This overview discusses the differences between the original “relayed” and the new brokered messaging patterns.
trans-unit.target: This overview discusses the differences between the original “relayed” and the new brokered messaging patterns.
